cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi (225 km) south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, forecast to cross Hispaniola, skirt the SE Bahamas and Turks & Caicos, then curl northward toward southern Florida and the southeast U.S. coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida coast (around or just north of Miami)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches limited to the central Bahamas – no watches posted north of Florida
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands westward across Hispaniola and Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Bahamas, Florida peninsula, and southeast U.S. coastline through Georgia/South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible late 3–4 Aug.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected based on current track and low wind probabilities
weather_observation.rainfall: Fringes of the system could bring 1–2 inches of rain to the Baltimore area 3–4 Aug.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal flooding and rip-current risk possible along the Mid-Atlantic beaches; operational delays mainly driven by precautionary port measures rather than direct storm impacts.
